{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3199965,"name":"Noah ","username":"DapperShark","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/3d9bf3/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-26T22:26:54.397Z","cooked":"

My robotics team has been chucking around a few ideas about a old t-shirt throwing cannon promo bot. We had a 10+ year old bot that had been sitting in storage for ages. We recently dug it out and wanted to perhaps replace some hardware, update everything and use it a bit for outreach.

To shoot the t shirts themselves it looks like we used Jar-topped sprinkler valves hooked up to something called a Vex Pro spike.

What in the world is a Vex Spike? From what I found online they were no longer legal as of 2014. What can I replace a vex spike with to make it semi- current day compatible?

Pictured below I have the sprinkler valve we used and the assembly on the robot for additional context.

image3024Ã—4032 3.27 MB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-26T22:26:54.397Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":454,"reads":484,"readers_count":483,"score":2381.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":436025,"topic_slug":"what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with","display_username":"Noah ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/d/9/d9e5158e00a2ae3995240458a2809f14164d6cc1.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59232,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with/436025/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3199984,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-26T22:31:44.049Z","cooked":"

Spikes are still legal in the current rules per R503 and R504.

If they still work, I wouldnâ€™t recommend touching them just because thereâ€™s no harm in leaving them. If they donâ€™t, you can replace them with either a CTRE PCM, REV PH, or multiple Automation Direct relay modules.

They are still legal see R503 letter B sub letter B

It is a relay. Actually a pair of relays setup up to make an H bridge. The Automation Direct solid state relay, available on First Choice can be used in its place to power a valve.

Keep in mind the sprinkler valves are not FRC legal.

From what I found online they were no longer legal as of 2014.

You may be getting confused by the fact that Spikes are no longer sold, as they are discontinued.

DapperShark:

make it semi- current day compatible?

If youâ€™re updating it to a newer control system, the spikes can plug in to the relay ports on the roborio and be controlled with the Relay class.

Speaking of, has anyone had success using the Automation Direct AD-SSR6M12-DC-200D? We havenâ€™t been able to get ours to work the way we expect.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-27T18:45:52.718Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":63.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":436025,"topic_slug":"what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with","display_username":"Robertson Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://firstchoicebyandymark.com/fc-at-4118","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Powered by AndyMark","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28014,"username":"bobbysq","name":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24506,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with/436025/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3200557,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-27T18:57:01.093Z","cooked":"

Unlike the Spikes, these are wired such that they would break/complete the circuit along one of the wires going to your load. The input side would get wired to the signal and ground of a DIO port.

Edit: Hereâ€™s what I mean:

ADRelayWiring859Ã—600 52.1 KB

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-28T01:56:51.126Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":74.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":436025,"topic_slug":"what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/8/8/887d4d631f1927e7aecdafa9322553dd129bff5e.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24506,"username":"s3529","name":"Robertson Robotics","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with/436025/9","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3200599,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-27T19:43:26.166Z","cooked":"

I concur with leaving the spikes if they still work, but yes, the AD relays are a suitable substitute, as are 5V relay modules similar to this:
5v Relay Module 1 Channel Relay Board for Raspberry Pi with Opto-Isolated High or Low Level Trigger 5v 1 Channel Relay Switch for Arduino: Amazon.com: Industrial & Scientific

What is of real concern are those sprinkler valves. Do not use random plastic items for pneumatics! When something with under water pressure breaks, it leaks and maybe spews. Because air is compressible, when something under air pressure breaks, the air can push on those broken parts for a good distance, creating shrapnel. Only use air-rated pneumatics to carry or switch air under pressure. This is especially true as these valves are a decade old and have likely become brittle due to outgassing, UV exposure, or both.
Added: Hereâ€™s something similar to what 3946 used. You want one thatâ€™s normally closed, solenoid (vs motor) driven, and likely 12V. Solenoid, because you want it to open fast. Just donâ€™t leave it open for long periods of time, or it will get hot. We found that 40-70 milliseconds was about right to launch a t-shirt with a 3/4" to 1" valve using 50-60psi.

Amazon.com: Beduan Brass Electric Solenoid Valve, 1" 12V Air Valve Normally Colsed for Water Air Gas Fuel Oil : Industrial & Scientific

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-27T20:02:29.267Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":123.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":436025,"topic_slug":"what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Relay-Module-Channel-Opto-Isolated-Trigger/dp/B09G6H7JDT/ref=sr_1_2_sspa","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":9},{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Beduan-Electric-Solenoid-Normally-Colsed/dp/B08C2P1P18/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else â¬›ðŸŸ«ðŸŸ¥ðŸŸ§ðŸŸ¨ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ¦ðŸŸªâ–’â–’â¬œ "},"post_url":"/t/what-is-a-vex-pro-spike-and-what-can-i-replace-it-with/436025/10","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else â¬›ðŸŸ«ðŸŸ¥ðŸŸ§ðŸŸ¨ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ¦ðŸŸªâ–’â–’â¬œ ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3200605,"name":"Nathan Nguyen","username":"Potttaaatttooo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/potttaaatttooo/{size}/189101_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-27T19:53:00.045Z","cooked":"

We used Spike Relays we had lying around for our T-Shirt Robot last year, and they worked fine. I donâ€™t see the point in swapping them out if they still work, especially since you wonâ€™t be spending more money/using motor controllers/relays you might use on your comp bot.

As @GeeTwo said, using sprinkler valves is not a good idea. If they break, you pretty much have a pipe bomb on your hands. You could replace em with some Solenoids from ESV (we got ours from ESV) and use a PWM motor controller you have lying around or the Spike to activate them.
